subject: Sleep
title: Turkey Makes You Sleepy
description: Learn Turkey Makes You Sleepy in one minute.

hook.text: Everyone blames the Thanksgiving turkey for their post-meal coma. Turkey is innocent. The real criminal is overeating.

buildup.text: Turkey contains tryptophan, but so does chicken, cheese, and many other foods in equal or greater amounts.

discovery.text: Tryptophan in food barely crosses the blood-brain barrier when consumed with other amino acids from a full meal.

twist.text: Post-Thanksgiving sleepiness comes from the massive carbohydrate load, alcohol, and sheer volume of food consumed.

climax.text: Carbohydrates trigger insulin release, which clears competing amino acids and actually helps tryptophan reach the brain.

punchline.text: It's not the turkey. It's the mountain of mashed potatoes and three slices of pie.

quiz.question: Why do people feel sleepy after Thanksgiving dinner?
options: The massive carbohydrate load, overeating, and alcohol cause the sleepiness
